positions.comment: Departed Town Cut at approximately 21:00 UTC.
148 nm in 1st 24 hours.  Front will come thru during night.  less wind tomorrow
Wind almost calm.  Looks like we will spend the night drifting to east.
Wiind filled out of SW during day at 15-18 kts.  Going light now.
Wind bldg to 20kts tonight, diminish by Thurs when we hope turn more NE.
Wnd 20-25 most of day, decrease tomorrow, Great sailing, lousy sleeping.
Wind down to 18 kts, turned to NE.  Much better sleeping.
Light wind.  Hdg NE to avoid current.  Engine on for 4 hours.
Continuing NE under engine power
Sailing directly toward Flores.  Check the WX charts tonight if course chg rqrd.
Wind shifted to E now NE.  Hdg to 40 N Lat before turning back to SE.
Heading to 40N before turning SE toward Flores
Wind dead on nose from Flores.  Taked North for the night.  SE in AM
Finally able to tack toward Flores.  If wind holds shd be in by Sunday
Land Ho!  Flores Island 30 miles dead ahead.
At anchor in Lajes Harbor, Flores, the Azores
Enroute from Flores to Horta.  Slowing down to arrive after dawn
Arrived in Horta at dawn on 24th.  Currently tied to seawall
Moved from Horta to Velas on Sao Jorge Island this afternoon.
Moved from Velas to Angra do Heroismo.  Berthed in a 1st class marina.
Still at Angra Mahrina.  Doing some touring today.  Leave Monday
Looks like we'll stay in Angra until Tuesday.  No wind no matter when we leave
Decided to stay over one more day in Angra.  Leave tomorrow
Passing 2nm NE of the seamount.  See fishing boat working on the mount
Arrived at Ponta Delgada at 8:00 AM. Not nearly so nice as Angra.
Departed Ponta Delgada at 16:00 UTC today.  Enroute to Lisbon
Few showers last night, clear all day.  Close reaching in 10 -  12 kts
Motoring NE to 40N, 15W.  Light winds and a few showers.
No wind, still motoring.  Hdg E, expecting to find N winds tomorrow.
Sailing slowly toward Cascais since yesterday evening.
Picked up the Portuguese Trades this AM.  Shd be in Cascais in tomorrow
Arrived at Cascais Reception Dock at 10:20 UTC
Taken berth for winter at Cascais Marina
Taken berth for winter at Cascais Marina
